top_comment.text:
It actually kinda felt like they were just trying to re-package Star Trek 
by putting it into an AU and then taking plot points from previous movies 
and throwing them into this movie.﻿
top_comment.author: Meredith Skinner

comments.text:
It's a pretty good movie. I'm not saying that I didn't like it, but I 
didn't like the feel that they were just trying to re-vamp the franchise. :(
comments.author: Meredith Skinner

comments.text:
+Meredith Skinner i can see how you'd think that, but in my opinion it's 
still a really good movie, even thought it doesn't have too much of the 
original star trek feel to it. I heard the next movie is going to be more 
like the original though
comments.author: xXAzuriteStormXx

top_comment.text:
The need for action is part of what makes this movie disappoint, perhaps if 
they didn't have to rush to get everywhere immediately there wouldn't be as 
much for Everything Wrong With and Honest Trailers to work with. You can 
like Cumberbatch, his performance and still be disappointed that he was 
Kahn rather say an American even British actor of Indian descent.

I wonder what a modern reboot of Star Trek looks like where action for the 
non-Trekkie audiences is not the focus but maybe the social commentary the 
original series is known for.

Is it possible for a movie that doesn't focus on just three of the 
characters? Why hire actors who are just attractive but can act if most of 
them never get the chance for more than 5 mins.﻿
top_comment.author: Tebigong101

comments.text:
+TheFinalSmash In 1967 when the episode aired they knew they needed a man 
of color to play the character, this was in an era when they didn't mind 
doing brown face but they didn't they made an effort to find a brown  man.

How in 2013 can less of an effort be made to address race and ethnicity of 
a character. The original Sulu was played by a Japanese actor the current 
is Korean, the original Uhura was of conventional African American heritage 
the current is Afro-Latino but in both instances they hired actors of 
color, which is my point, rather than replace them with white actors.
comments.author: Tebigong101

comments.text: You do remember that the original Khan was played by a Mexican, right?
comments.author: TheFinalSmash

captions.text:
Where did you come from?
The Enterprise, duh. I beamed in.

You beamed in?
Yeah. I thought you were a movie buff. Star

Trek? Transporters? I beamed in.
Yeah, I'm familiar with the terminology. I'm

also familiar with the fact that Star Trek
is science fiction, and therefore not real.

So how did you get here?
Dude. Star Trek is real. Alright? You take

that back you (censored).
Whoa! Dude! I forgot how much of a Trekkie

you are.
It's Trekker, alright? You know we like to

be referred to as Trekkers. You know, I don't
have to take this. I can go back to the Enterprise.

Calm down, alright? You came here to talk
to me about something, so what was it?

I saw Star Trek Into Darkness. I thought you
might want to talk about it.

Yeah.
Did you see it?

Yeah, I thought it was f*cking awesome. What
did you think?

Well, it has some pros and it has some cons.
Yeah? Usually you only find the cons.

Well, it's Star Trek, so, I gotta give it
pro points just for being Star Trek in the

first place, even though it's not the real
Star Trek. Also, this is the second Star Trek

movie in a row that's given us a hot chick
in her underwear. I don't know what's up with

that, but it's awesome! So, that's another
pro.

I'm still waiting to find out what the con
is.

Well, the villain. I didn't like the villain
at all.

What?! Come on! Benedict Cumberbatch? Man,
he was the best thing about this movie! He

was awesome.
I thought he was terrible.

Oh, come on.
I thought he was terrible.

I mean, Star Trek villains are supposed to
be these big, awesome, famous actors. Like

Ricardo Montalban, or Christopher Lloyd, or
that guy from Sound of Music. But this time

all we get is British Sherlock Holmes.
Dude. Sherlock Holmes is always British. Always.

Not when it's Robert Downy Junior. Not when
it's Lucy Liu!

How can you be aware enough culturally to
know that all of those people are in Sherlock

Holmes adaptations, but not know that Sherlock
Holmes is British? Or that Lucy Liu is playing

f*cking Watson?! How can you be that dumb?
All I'm saying is that I would have preferred

another actor.
I thought he was awesome. He was the best

thing about the film. Even people who hate
this movie are gonna rave about him. Him and

Kirk, you know? Locked in mortal combat. What's
not to like?

Well, I mean, to start with, it's the Kirk
and Spock show, this movie. I mean—

Yeah, it was awesome.
I like Scotty, Uhura, Chekov, Bones. I miss

those guys.
All of those people are in this movie.

I didn't see them.
Well, you have a reputation for not looking

hard enough.
No, I have a reputation for paying too much

attention. Sometimes it does make me miss
some details. So if you say they were in it,

I'm willing to take your word for it.
I appreciate that.

I'm still surprised you liked it as much as
you did.

You shouldn't be. This movie's awesome, dude!
It is action packed!

Your pants are action-packed.
Well now how am I even supposed to be offended

by that. I mean, like, what scenario can you
think of where that would be anything but

a compliment?
If you add "pants" onto an insult, it makes

it more insulting, even if it's a compliment.
Whatever, dude. This movie's awesome. It's

got action, romance, bromance, space. Everything
I want in my Star Trek.

1: Whatever. It's got action, romance, friendship,
drama, space... everything I want in my Star

Trek.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. It is not your

Star Trek. It is not anyone's Star Trek. It's
everybody's Star Trek.

I'm sorry. I didn't mean to take ownership
of it.

If this movie's so awesome, then why isn't
it, like, headlining the Cannes Film Festival

this week?
Cannes.

What?
It's Cannes. Not Cannes.

No, I'm pretty sure it's Cannes. Or Cannes.
Or maybe Can-ness. But definitely not Cannes.

Right, because you're the authority on how
to pronounce French words.

You know what, dude? I could call the Enterprise
at any time I want and have them beam you

to freaking Mars, or out in the middle of
space.

Why don't you do that?
Or, better yet, I could use this phaser Captain

Pike gave me and shoot you.
That is not a phaser.

It's set to kill.
That is a set of hair clippers.

No, this is a phaser that's made to look like
a set of clippers. Big difference. This thing

will kill you.
Let's see it.
Oh sh*t.

title: Star Trek Into Darkness - Pros & Cons - Conversations With Myself About Movies
